Then once the destruction is over, I (as a demon) would simply ask, "was it worth it? Killing so many innocent people? Tearing apart families and turn children with happy families into orphans? You truly are a hero. A hero among demons for killing oh so many humans. So don't worry about the consequences of your actions. After all, [one death is a tragedy and a million is a statistic]. So don't worry about it, 'hero'. Keep amusing me."

After all, the easiest opponent is one who thinks more with their emotions rather than precise rational thought. If I were a demon, I would definitely pull the strings to make that doujin real. After all, physical wounds can heal over time, but mental wounds caused by severe trauma can greatly impact an individual's future thought processes and personality. As such, this doujin is such a great example of how to turn a hero into a monster - the best part of it being is that NO EXCUSES can be made on the hero's part! Think of it - murdering billions of humans all because they can't keep their own emotions in check!

A real demon chooses their moves with cold and calculated precision, using whatever tools and information they have at their disposal to win. A truly effective villain would also be great at being charismatic, detailed knowledge of the law, and twist the hero's weakness against them in order to eliminate the hero before he/she has the courage to surpass their strength.

You're all talking about what would happen if this was written by the author this doujin is based on, but remember - this doujin isn't written by the author that this doujin is based on. Furthermore, do you really think it would be THAT easy? It's very likely that the villains could be backed up by a demon who could take advantage of how weak Issei's emotional control is (from what you all are saying) to cause Earth to be destroyed, THUS winning in the end. There be no happy ending because the villain (a hypothetical demon pulling the strings) would win regardless. The "hero" let the villain win all because he can't control his rage.

MrTrigger clearly hasn't seen/read High School DxD. Issei would go berserk and unleash all of his power if someone did something to his Girls, especially Rias and Asia.

@metroid: Not at all, friend. I fully appreciate that Netorare, for better or worse, has its place in the scheme of things, although I certainly haven't always felt that way... *ahem* But perhaps an example would do better to convince: say, for instance, you have a character who is canonically paired with another; as a couple, they are perfect together. The guy is a wonderful person, the sort one would be blessed to call a friend, while the girl is equally as wonderful, the "perfect wife" so many dream of. As a couple, they are perfect, however, for whatever reason, they just don't seem like they'd go well together as "partners" to you. In a case like this, I feel like Netorare is perfectly justified, at the very least, and perhaps even a welcome change of pace. As far as original works are concerned, it's a bit more complicated: for me there needs to be adequate build-up, but that's an ambiguous line at best. Regardless, Netorare still has its place, as all things in life do. v_v

@Nagakura: Actually, I agree that the manga (and presumably the light novels as well) is terrible. However, the anime, if you actually WATCH it, is an entirely different matter. The degree of exposition is worlds apart from the source material; rather than "Damn, I love boobs." it's "How do boobs captivate me so? Let me count the ways..." For a "fan" of things like anime, manga, and such, you should really try looking at each format objectively, as separate modes of delivery can make all the difference.

@NullHorizon, "This series deserves more love"? Read a real book. There's a reason these LNs will never be localized; DxD's author is total shit. Even when he uses pure dumb coincidence to drive every plot element, he still can't keep himself from writing plot holes into every arc and making his characters all slip into talking like middle school otaku or nonsensically acting against their personalities. It's the worst kind of wish fulfillment, lazy pandering, and it makes the rest of us pervert anime fans look bad when this trash gets praise by people like you.
@moeslayer It is 100% confirmed that he is if you look at his hypocritical comments on other works.

STOP YOU HAVE VIOLATED THE LAW

You know, the one thing no one ever seems to consider is that pulling shit like this against Issei would basically be tantamount to dooming all of existence to inevitable ruin. I mean, with the balance of the world as precarious as it is within the plot, y'know, with God himself and many of the various other pantheons and groups having been obliterated... Well, it wouldn't take all that much for it all to fall to pieces, and after something like this, you'd have a Red Dragon Emperor on a mindless rampage from Issei becoming overwhelmed by rage. Even if he WERE the type to become a cuckold, the initial rage would override any other emotions by virtue of the Red Dragon's nature. By the time he felt that rage, he'd already be lost, thus unable to feel anything further. ...I suppose it is what it is, though. Ah well. I just want more Asia. And Koneko. ...And Akeno. Actually, just more of all the girls. This series deserves more love! >3<
